alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Hunterdon, west central Somerset and central Bucks Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 414 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lumberville, or 19 miles northwest of Trenton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manville, Doylestown, Byram, Bedminster, Flemington, Tinicum, High Bridge, Clinton, New Hope, Dublin, Glen Gardner, Hampton, Frenchtown, Lebanon, Milford, Stockton, Flagtown, Lumberville, Ottsville and Sergeantsville. This includes Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 10 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
